Name: Anatomist
Condition: Birds with body parts in their names
Explanatory text: Body parts include back, beak, belly, bill, breast, cap, chin, collar, crest, crown, eye, face, head, leg, neck, rump, shoulder, tail, throat, toe, wing

rulings.text: The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon and those in the relevant section of the European Expansion rulebook. Substrings of bird names that coincide with names of body parts do not count toward the bonus when not referring to body parts (e.g., the wing in Burrowing Owl).
On this bonus card `name` refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.

Name: Backyard Birder
Condition: Birds worth less than 4 points
Note: Count the birds you played that have a face value of 0, 1, 2, or 3 points.

Name: Behaviorist
Condition: For each column that contains birds with 3 different power colors:
Explanatory text: Birds with no power count as white.

Name: Bird Bander
Condition: Birds that can live in multiple habitats

Name: Bird Counter
Condition: Birds with a [flocking] power
Note: Count the birds you played that have the specific symbol shown on this bonus card. The symbol should be on the left-hand side of the bird’s brown power.

Name: Bird Feeder
Condition: Birds that eat [seed]

Name: Breeding Manager
Condition: Birds that have at least 4 eggs laid on them
Note: Count only bird cards that have 4 egg tokens sitting on them at game end.

Name: Cartographer
Condition: Birds with geography terms in their name
Explanatory text: Terms include American, Atlantic, Baltimore, California, Canada, Carolina, Chihuahua, Corsican, Eastern, Eurasian, European, Inca, Mississippi, Moor, Mountain, Northern, Prairie, Sandhill, Savannah, Western

rulings.text: The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon, including prairie (which is printed on the bonus card only in newer printings), and those in the relevant section of the European Expansion rulebook.
On this bonus card `name` refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.

Name: Citizen Scientist
Condition: Birds with tucked cards

rulings.text: In games where the Automa has drawn this bonus card, the Automa selects birds that have tucking powers; these powers are precisely those which contain the word `tuck' or `tucked'.

Name: Diet Specialist
Condition: Birds with a food cost of 3 food

Name: Ecologist
Condition: Birds in your habitat with the fewest birds.
Note: Count the number of birds you played, in the habitat where you played the fewest birds. If you have two habitats tied for fewest birds, you may still score this bonus. For example, if all of your habitats have 3 birds in them, your habitat with the fewest birds has 3 birds in it.

Name: Enclosure Builder
Condition: Birds with [ground] nests
Explanatory text: Birds must have a [ground] or [star] nest symbol.
Note: Count the number of birds you played that have the specific nest symbol shown on the card. Star nests [star] are wild. Birds with star nests count toward all four of these bonuses.

Name: Ethologist
Condition: In any one habitat:
Explanatory text: Birds with no power count as white.

Name: Falconer
Condition: Birds with a [predator] power
Note: Count the birds you played that have the specific symbol shown on this bonus card. The symbol should be on the left-hand side of the bird’s brown power.

Name: Fishery Manager
Condition: Birds that eat [fish]

Name: Food Web Expert
Condition: Birds that eat only [invertebrate]

Name: Forest Data Analyst
Condition: Consecutive birds in [forest] with ascending or descending wingspans
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]

Name: Forester
Condition: Birds that can only live in [forest]
Note: Count the number of birds you played that only have the habitat symbol shown on this bonus card. If a bird has the option to live in more than one type of habitat, it cannot count toward this bonus.

Name: Grassland Data Analyst
Condition: Consecutive birds in [grassland] with ascending or descending wingspans
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]

Name: Historian
Condition: Birds named after a person
Explanatory text: Any bird with an 's in its name.

Name: Large Bird Specialist
Condition: Birds with wingspans over 65 cm
Note: Count the birds you played that have wingspans over 65cm. Wingspans of exactly 65cm do not count toward this bonus.

Name: Mechanical Engineer
Condition: Sets of the 4 nest types
Explanatory text: Each star nest can be treated as any 1 nest type. No card can be part of more than one set.

Name: Nest Box Builder
Condition: Birds with [cavity] nests
Explanatory text: Birds must have a [cavity] or [star] nest symbol.
Note: Count the number of birds you played that have the specific nest symbol shown on the card. Star nests [star] are wild. Birds with star nests count toward all four of these bonuses.

Name: Omnivore Specialist
Condition: Birds that eat [wild]
Explanatory text: Any bird that specifically has a [wild] symbol as part of its food cost.

Name: Oologist
Condition: Birds that have at least 1 egg laid on them
Note: Count only bird cards that have at least 1 egg token sitting on them at game end.

Name: Passerine Specialist
Condition: Birds with wingspans 30 cm or less
Note: Count the birds you played that have wingspans 30cm or less. Wingspans of exactly 30cm count toward this bonus.

Name: Photographer
Condition: Birds with colors in their names
Explanatory text: Colors include ash, black, blue, bronze, brown, cerulean, chestnut, coal, ferruginous, gold, gray, grey, green, honey, indigo, lazuli, purple, red, rose, roseate, ruby, ruddy, rufous, snowy, violet, white, yellow

rulings.text: The 3-point bonus applies when there are 4--5 qualifying birds on your player mat, not 2--3. (This misprint was corrected in the third printing, and a corrected card is available in the update pack)

The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon, those in the relevant section of the European Expansion rulebook, and violet. (Violet currently occurs only on the Violet-Green Swallow, which already contains another keyword for this bonus card.) Substrings of bird names that coincide with color names do not count toward this bonus when not referring to colors (e.g., the red in Barred Owl), but see European Honey Buzzard and Northern Bobwhite.
On this bonus card `name` refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.

Name: Platform Builder
Condition: Birds with [platform] nests
Explanatory text: Birds must have a [platform] or [star] nest symbol.
Note: Count the number of birds you played that have the specific nest symbol shown on the card. Star nests [star] are wild. Birds with star nests count toward all four of these bonuses.

Name: Prairie Manager
Condition: Birds that can only live in [grassland]
Note: Count the number of birds you played that only have the habitat symbol shown on this bonus card. If a bird has the option to live in more than one type of habitat, it cannot count toward this bonus.

Name: Rodentologist
Condition: Birds that eat [rodent]

rulings.text: The bonus card's condition is "Birds that eat [rodent]", not "Birds that only eat [rodent]", and its clarification text is, "Any bird with a [rodent] symbol. The bird may also eat other kinds of food." (These errors were corrected in the third printing, and a corrected card is available in the update pack.)

Name: Site Selection Expert
Condition: Columns with a matching pair or trio of nests
Explanatory text: Different columns may (but need not) score using different nest types. Star nests are wild, but each counts only once.
VP: 2 of the same nest in a column: 1[point]; 3 of the same nest in a column: 3[point]

Name: Visionary Leader
Condition: Bird cards in hand at end of game
Note: Count the bird cards still in your hand at the end of the game.

Name: Viticulturalist
Condition: Birds that eat [fruit]

Name: Wetland Data Analyst
Condition: Consecutive birds in [wetland] with ascending or descending wingspans
VP: 3 consecutive birds: 3[point]; 4 consecutive birds: 5[point]; 5 consecutive birds: 8[point]

Name: Wetland Scientist
Condition: Birds that can only live in [wetland]
Note: Count the number of birds you played that only have the habitat symbol shown on this bonus card. If a bird has the option to live in more than one type of habitat, it cannot count toward this bonus.

Name: Wildlife Gardener
Condition: Birds with [bowl] nests
Explanatory text: Birds must have a [bowl] or [star] nest symbol.
Note: Count the number of birds you played that have the specific nest symbol shown on the card. Star nests [star] are wild. Birds with star nests count toward all four of these bonuses.

Name: [automa] Autwitcher
Condition: Birds that are worth 3 or 4 points
Explanatory text: The automa keeps up to 2 of them (higher value first).

Name: [automa] RASPB Life Fellow
Condition: Birds that are worth 5, 6, or 7 points
Explanatory text: The automa keeps the highest valued one.
